metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7980 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in Cirrus CLGD 54xx VGA Emulator in Quick Emulator (Qemu) 2.8 and earlier allows local guest OS users to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (crash) via vectors related to a VNC client updating its display after a VGA operation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7980` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-kvm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-common - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-user - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-user-static - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
qemu-utils - 1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.8+dfsg-3ubuntu3').
